definition: to set off
(of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee

sentences.english: Light colours provide an effective backdrop for pictures or a mirror.
sentences.chinese: 浅色是挂放图画或镜子很有效果的衬托。

sentences.english: Shadows on the hills, sketch the trees and the daffodils.
sentences.chinese: 山上的阴影，衬托出树和水仙的轮廓。

sentences.english: Our classroom building stood out clearly against the blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 蓝天清晰地衬托出我们的教学大楼。

sentences.english: The color scheme was brown, with the mouldings picked out in orange.
sentences.chinese: 整个图案是棕色的，用桔黄色的壁线来加以衬托。

sentences.english: An aromatic bouquet of red fruit on a base of Viennese pastry.
sentences.chinese: 维也纳甜糕衬托出红色水果的香醇。

sentences.english: The dark-coloured frame shows off the painting well.
sentences.chinese: 深色的画框图衬托得很好看。

sentences.english: A charming flushed cheeks, contrasts with the girl is far from mind.
sentences.chinese: 一抹娇羞映红了脸颊，衬托着少女渐浓渐远的心思。

sentences.english: The bleakness is with strong red and green background, dispersing after a grand feast.
sentences.chinese: 这是一片大红大绿衬托出的苍凉，盛宴后的散席。

sentences.english: Beautifully balanced with red fruit and plum flavors followed by a wood sensation.
sentences.chinese: 红果与李子的口味在橡木味道衬托下颇为平衡。

sentences.english: Delicate banquet, return so that tableware foils .
sentences.chinese: 美味筵席，还得餐具衬托。

sentences.english: Set off by two gardens, the three European style building look elegant and magnificent.
sentences.chinese: 三幢欧式建筑在两座花园的衬托下尽显高贵典雅之气。

sentences.english: The black tree was clearly defined against a yellow sky.
sentences.chinese: 那棵黑色的树在黄色天空的衬托下显得轮廓分明。

sentences.english: Red flags stand out against the blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 红旗在蓝旗的衬托下很显眼。

sentences.english: However, it must be acknowledged, she had faults to foil her gifts.
sentences.chinese: 可是必须承认她也有缺点来衬托她的优点。

sentences.english: The beauty of the girl's face is matched only by the incredible richness of her dress.
sentences.chinese: 女孩漂亮的脸蛋也只有身上的华服才能衬托出。

sentences.english: The fashion sets her figure off to advantage.
sentences.chinese: 那件时装把她的身段衬托得更加优美。

definition: to set off by contrast/antithesis/analogy parallelism (linguistics)
background (of a painting)/backdrop/a foil (to set off something to advantage)/to offset (something to advantage)
(of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially
to enhance by contrast/to set off/to serve as a background in order to bring out the subject with greater brilliance/to serve as a prop/a foil
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
to decorate/to adorn/sprinkled/studded/only for show
to contrast/to set off one another/to go well with
to decorate/to dress up/to deck
to set off/to highlight by contrast
to decorate
to present clearly/to give prominence to/to magnify/clear and obvious
fascinating/enchanting/charming/tempting
to come to prominence/to appear clearly/to stick out
to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to polish (a written piece)/to qualify or modify (grammar)
to shine upon/to reflect
to manifest
